Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Steamed
Reviews.Content: Learned the hard way that Fuji camera movable lens are not sealed from dust and grit and Fuji does do not cover a camera that stops working due to dust or grit under warranty.  Sent a camera under warranty to them due to the lens not moving in or out.  Warranty was declined, claiming the warranty does not cover failure due to dust or grit getting into the lens mechanism.  They offered to repair it for almost as much as the camera cost.  I have never had that problem with other brands.  I am back to using two older cameras.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Saperstein
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm (Fuji) makes good cameras. I've owned or used some of them. The SL300, however, is far from the top of the pack. Nothing about the SL300 is awful or a real show-stopper, but there are lots of things which are not top-notch about this camera. Image quality at ISO 400 or above deteriorates so rapidly that the resulting images are unusable for serious purposes at 100%. Lots of noise. In my test shots down my street, filled with trees in various stages of changing color, at ISO 800 - which was necessary for hand-held shots in the minutes before sunset - the leaves resolved to smudges and blobs. Mortar between the bricks of the building across the street were somewhat indistinct. The 30X zoom is supposed to be a selling point, but in my real-world testing, the zoom was very slow and the autofocus was incredibly slow and imprecise. Handheld shots at ISO 800 were blurred - the image stabilization simply wasn't up to the task. I used the flash in an interior hallway, about 20 feet long with some ambient illumination at both ends. The flash was barely sufficient to illuminate the end of the hallway. I did some flash shots inside a dark room. A wall about 10 feet away was not only not evenly illuminated, but the pre-flash focus didn't work well and the things hanging on the wall were not in focus. There's a see-through viewfinder that is very grainy. The dipter adjustment is limited and very difficult to work with. The 3" LCD is bright and pretty clear, but strikes me as having less visible area than other cameras with the same screen size.  Manual control, a necessity for creative photography is very limited. I couldn't find any way to get an aperture of either f3.1 or f8. That appears to be it. The camera is quite large, almost as if the designers intentionally wanted it to look like an expensive DSLR. It is also somewhat heavy. On the whole, I am not favorably impressed. I consider myself an intermediate, perhaps even advanced, hobbyist. For my serious shooting, the SL300 simply won't do for the reasons listed above. However, for some people who shoot outdoors in bright light and with a low ISO, the extreme telephoto might come in handy. So three-stars seems fair.Jerry

Reviews.Title: A `tweener camera for fence-sitting amateurs
Reviews.Author: Eric C. Sedensky "late-to-jazz musician"
Reviews.Content: Allow me to start with a disclaimer: I have studied photography in a formal setting, and have used professional or near-professional grade cameras, lenses, and equipment (yes, even film) for the better part of 25 years. I'm not a beginner. So, right away, I noticed this camera did not, and could not, perform anywhere near professional level. That said, I think this is still a fairly decent, easy to use camera at a very reasonable price point.This camera comes with far fewer manual settings than most cameras. Also, the zoom feature is controlled by a motor from a switch on the side of the lens. It is slow to respond and difficult to control, but assuming that most people will only ever go all the way in or all the way out (for the most part), it's not much of a drawback. The lens cap is also a little funky, with the grip levers in the middle, presumably to reduce the chance of putting a fingerprint or garbage on the lens when removing it. To take photos, you have the all or nothing option of viewing through the viewfinder or looking at the screen on the back. The viewfinder is not a true viewfinder, but actually a mini display screen inside the view finder. It looked funky and unnatural. As for taking pictures, this operated quite intuitively, and I was able to take acceptable photographs of objects and scenery and pets, always in good lighting with little or no movement. In low lighting, it was not able to compensate (without using the flash) for the light levels, and most low light shots ended up being blurry. For someone who has never had a professional camera and has always used a point-and-shoot or pocket model, its performance will be noticeably better than those.This camera talks a lot. It has all kinds of beeps, and dings, and whoops, and the photo snapping sound is the weirdest of all. Again, if you are used to something better, this may be an issue, but if this is your first digital SLR, you will probably learn the meaning of all the little noises and be quite comfortable operating the camera in no time.The strap is solid and handy, but the slots are poorly designed with some sticky-out portions that make threading the strap the hardest thing about this camera. If you're replacing a point and shoot and don't need a strap, that would be lucky.I didn't use the panorama feature, which combines multiple shots into a long, scaled photograph, but the missus was excited about it. She said that it did sort of okay, but that the stitching was inadequate, so again, another feature somewhere in the middle - maybe useful for some people, probably not very useful for others.All in all, this is an above average camera for a low to low-mid-scale market. If you aren't publishing your pictures and taking a bajillion of them, this is a good choice to save some money and get decent results. If you really need to take high-quality, high-definition pictures under different conditions, or are planning a trip of a lifetime or something like that, you might want to consider adding a couple hundred bucks to your camera budget and spring for a Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens and EOS HD Movie Mode (Black) or something along those lines instead. Otherwise, this Fuji will work.

Reviews.Title: good entry-level digital camera
Reviews.Author: Terry R. Nye
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm FinePix SL300 digital camera is a fine entry-level digital camera for those interested in playing around with digital photography without spending a lot of money.  For such an inexpensive camera it is loaded with features that will enable you to easily take photos, shoot video, and create special effects.The camera arrives well-packaged with everything you need to take pictures except the memory card.  You will want to buy a good SDHC memory card to use with it.  There is no printed owner's manual - it is all on a CD - which is a disappointment.  The provided quick start information is enough to get you going, though.  The included lithium ion rechargeable battery needs to be charged before the camera is used.  The battery is rather large but charges quickly.  The included charger is a little odd.  You have to slide on a separate piece with the AC plug which locks onto the main charger.  If you lose that piece you are out of luck.  A USB cable is included to connect the camera to your computer.  Like full-size SLR cameras, the lens uses a plastic lens cap (included) which also comes with a special tether you can use to secure it to your camera when not in use.  The camera cannot be turned on, though, until you remove the lens cover.  If you forget, the LCD screen will give you a reminder to turn the camera off and remove the cover before turning it back on.The camera itself is a little bulky.  It is definitely smaller than a typical SLR digital camera but clearly not a pocket camera either.  For its size it is quite lightweight.  It has a rather cheap plastic feel to it that makes it feel very fragile.  Cameras should never be handled roughly, but this one likely merits extra care.  The lens is not removable like a true SLR camera, but it has an impressive 30x optical zoom that will get you close to your subject.  The LCD screen on the back is very big and clear.  The controls are well-placed and easy to use.  I found it very intuitive to use the controls to navigate between the different options, and it is fairly simple to figure out even without usage of the owner's manual.  You change shooting modes with a wheel switch on the top of the camera, and whenever you make a change the LCD screen will tell you what mode you have selected and what it can do.  Like other SLR cameras you can adjust aperture and shutter speed settings to get creative with your picture taking, although the availability of only two aperture settings (F3.1 and F8) is very disappointing.  There are several automatic modes available including aperture priority, shutter speed priority, manual, auto, scene-based auto, panorama, and video.  The built-in flash is automatic, but you have to open it with a push button first in order for it to work.  There is a flash shoe on the top of the viewfinder that enables you to attach a separate flash if desired.  It's a nice feature that you would expect on a much nicer SLR, but I really can't imagine someone purchasing a separate flash for this camera as it would cost as much or more as the camera itself.So how well does it work?  The photos are quite good in decent light.  You can shoot at normal or high resolution, and at 14 megapixels you will get resolution easily good enough for printing photos or posters.  The color is accurate.  The camera adjusts well to low-light situations in auto mode, and it shoots fairly quickly for a camera in this class.  It can even be set to detect if someone blinks when shooting portrait photos so you will know to shoot it again.  You do not have the range of creativity that a more expensive true SLR camera would offer, particularly with its limited aperture settings, but you can take some pretty nice photos with this camera.Overall, you get a lot of camera at this price point.  This is not the camera to buy if you want something to carry in your pocket.  You will definitely want to buy a bag for it.  It is not the camera to buy if you want to be able to use different lenses.  But it is a very good entry-level camera for someone who is new to digital photography or interested in experimenting with what an SLR camera can do without having to spend a lot of money.  If you want to spend under $300 for a digital camera with some features similar to an SLR camera, and this one is currently selling for well under that, the Fujifilm FinePix SL300 is well worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix SL300 - Love it!
Reviews.Author: JP6611
Reviews.Content: My review is from the POV of someone who is a complete beginner to photography.  I didn't buy this camera because I enjoy photography, I bought it because I wanted something to catalog memories with a picture but also wanted to have a camera that could zoom in more than my Sony Cybershot. If you're interest are similar, this camera is definitely for you!The price is great, I bought it new (open box) so there are no defects that I'm aware of. The picture quality is above average when you're shooting a picture under the right setting. After a couple weeks of familiarizing myself with the settings I think I'll have it down better. I bought the red model and I love the way it looks! Here are a few pros and cons:Pros:Great outdoor/indoor picture quality (better outdoors though)Lightweight but sturdyEasy to useUnder pricedCons:Inconsistent picture resultsHard to photograph a moving target

Reviews.Title: Avoid FUJI cameras! The USB port is not covered by warranty
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon in January but did not actually use it until late February. The USB Port seemed to be jammed the first time I used it. Yes, I inserted the cable properly. I have purchased over a dozen digital cameras (for myself and family members), so I'm always mindful to check the curvature of the USB connection. The second time I tried to use the USB port, it was so difficult that I thought I had somehow turned the cable the wrong way. Upon checking, I had inserted it properly. The problem was clearly with the port inside the camera.  I returned the camera to FUJI for repair. Two weeks later, I get a form letter saying that it would cost $150.00 to repair the USB Port! That's exactly what I paid for the camera, so clearly they are insane. I guess they were going to use my money to buy another one from Amazon to send to me. :-(  What company makes a product and doesn't cover essential parts in the warranty? FUJI, for one. The camera works well, but you can find a equally good one from Kodak, Olympus, and others at this price and feature range. It's only advantage is the connection for a hotshoe.  I am giving it ONE STAR (I would give it ZERO) because Fuji swindles customers by not covering the USB Port, and I'm sure most consumers don't know that.  I hope that other reviewers will start indicating whether a certain part on the camera is not covered by the warranty since that is critically important in the purchasing decision. Had I known that FUJI would pull a stunt like this, I would NEVER have bought this darn camera. I do not need a $150.00 desk weight.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Ashley Woods "Ashley"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful photos very simply.  As an amateur photographer and not having the time or funds to explore the fancy cameras, I find this camera to be perfect for my needs.  I can quickly and easily photograph my daughter or scenery on vacation.  This is the best money can buy if your price range is $150-200.The only thing I dislike about this camera is that it is a tad too automatic.  I wish that on the rare day I have the time to customize the settings that I would have more options.  But for the price, it is a wonderful camera.UPDATE:I was able to use this camera over the weekend in D.C.  (Two moths after purchase.)  This is the first trip I've taken it on and the first time I've had the opportunity to really see what it can do.I set it on automatic and took several pictures as we walked.  If I didn't stop completely, the photos turned out blurry.  I did get some beautiful photos of the Washington and Lincoln Memorial at sunset.  The color wasn't as vivid in the photos, but that is an easy editing fix.When we were at Ford's Theatre, I had the most difficult time trying to get a decent photo in low lighting.  I ended up snapping a few with my iPhone - which much to my surprise turned out quite crisp and clear.I still must say, for the price, I am quite pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Artist among the pretenders..
Reviews.Author: Secundus Tacitus
Reviews.Content: When Fuji came out with their first digital camera, it was absolutely great for what it was.  It was so great that Kodak had them make a who bunch of them and sold them under their name.  Anyway, the 14MP with physical zoom is the original all grown up.  Now it's NOT a NIKON top of the  line, but then, who's got 3,500 Euros to dump into a professional camera.  But if your ambient light source is strong or daylight, you can get great sports stop-action shots.  The close-up feature (I know, I'm using actual English, instead of photography-speak)  is wonderfully easy to use, as is the switching from mode to mode.Let's say I'm completely insane and that I come from the planet Zippzoid and I don't know crap about photography.  Or you could believe the truth and some of my photos rest in the homes of some very big-time interesting people.  Either way, you should buy it, try it, and marvel at its abilities.  And if you don't like it, DANG, PEOPLE, you can send it back to AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a beginner or a teenager. Zoom lens and some good features.
Reviews.Author: AmazonDiva "Keep Calm and Carry On."
Reviews.Content: There are several reviews here comparing this camera to DSLRs and they mention that this camera comes up short. Well, that is to be expected as DSLRs are in the $600 plus price range and this camera is sub $200.Cameras with greater zooms have become popular in recent times as cell phones now offer better picture taking than some point and shoots. These days hardly anyone carries that tiny point and shoot as the smartphone suffices, plus you can instantly share your pictures. That is the reason for the advent of these bigger greater zoom cameras at low price points. This camera from Fujifilm is great for a beginner who wants to graduate from instagraming from their smartphone camera to taking some real shots.Fujifilm has always excelled at putting large zoom lenses on consumer point and shoots at a reasonable price point, but overall if you compare picture taking abilities their cameras fall behind Canon, Nikon and even Panasonic in a similar category. I already have a Canon DSLR (T3i) and other smaller zoom point and shoots (Canon,Panasonic, and Fujifilm 2-3 years old). My teenager was looking for a higher zoom camera for her photography and not wanting to hand over the DSLR I gave this camera to her and she absolutely loves it.This camera is very versatile due to higher zoom but it's also pretty bulky, so the one disadvantage is that you may not want to carry it at all times. However, its a must for any occasion where you know you will be taking photographs. Since we got this camera, I hardly ever take my lower zoom point and shoots anywhere. It takes wonderful pictures in good natural lighting. The colors are natural and pictures are sharp. In my opinion, Canon P&S; cameras sometimes over process and over saturate colors but Fujifilm colors come out more natural. It allowed my daughter to take some wonderfully natural portraits of family from a slight distance and our expressions were very natural as we were unaware she was taking them. This has proved to be an asset even at parties. The camera does have an intelligent mode which allows you to take the same picture in natural lighting and then fires the flash for the same picture, so if you're not sure you'll get the best image with natural lighting you can use that mode.There is a Panorama mode that allows longer shots for panoramic nature shots. This type of shot is also available in other brands such as Canon in scene modes but Fujifilm offers it as a dial setting which is convenient.The shutter speed of the camera is a little slow for action shots but it can still take respectable shots at a distance if the movement is relatively show, as in a school performance. The outdoor natural light performance of this camera is much better than the indoor low light performance. However, this is the case with most point and shoots but Fujifilm requires a little more handling in adjusting white balance and aperture than say, a Sony camera. I've found Sony cameras or some CMOS based cameras to perform the best in low lighting. The Manual mode can be selected and adjustments made for low lighting.The Macro mode of this camera is useful, and allowed me to take some detailed foliage pictures.The one big downside of this camera is that it does not have an onscreen battery indicator and sometimes the camera just died on me when I thought the battery was fully charged.So overall, a decent camera for the money. If you can spend another $50 or $100 you should look at Canon, Panasonic, Nikon brand cameras that are a little more expensive (for similar zoom and other features) but offer easier picture taking in multiple scenarios. With the Fujifilm you have to work a little bit if you don't have great lighting to take great shots.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price....
Reviews.Author: Confucious
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent for the price. It is like a point-and-shoot and dslr in one. On occasion we usually take our own cameras but we sometimes settle on this one to carry less. My wife likes to use it in the auto or p setting. I like to use the s (shutter) or a (aperture) setting. This camera is a little smaller than some dslr's and it is easier on her hands. I am still able to use it and control it comfortably in my hands as well. The picture quality is really good on the camera. You get real nice colors and sharp photos too. The video function is a plus as my wife's point-and-shoot cameras video function is crappy. My dsrl (xti) does not even have a video option which is why this camera travels with us when we are together. This is an excellent camera for someone who is used to point-and-shoot cameras but wants to get into the dslr market. You can get your feet wet without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: Nicely Finished Camera- Beautiful Pictures
Reviews.Author: JUST-JIM
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had to return the 1st one. I found it had a lot of slop when fully zoomed in. It was not snug fitting between the zoom barrel and the outer barrel. When you shook the camera with the zoom extended it made a slight "clanking" noise. I called Fuji technical service and they told me this was not normal. It took excellent pictures both tele and normal and all other functions performed properly. Fuji told me the camera evidently had a defect. I called Amazon, explained the situation and they shipped me a new one overnight. This is why I buy most everything from Amazon. Ups just picked up the return and Fedex delivered the replacement. It was in pristine condition and had 50% less play than the original. Just finished putting it thru its paces and Im well satisfied. Thanks Amazon and Fuji.

Reviews.Title: The best digital camera ever!
Reviews.Author: douglasmutay "Douglas Mutay"
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-professional photographer and I have specialized myself in capturing panoramic scenes. I was looking for a powerful camera that could make accurate panoramas as well as professional capture.This camera is just perfect for the job. With a beautiful layout and sweet touch, its handhold is excellent. I loved immediately.I am extremely grateful to Amazon customer service. They helped me enormously because I had some problem during the online payment. But they were so professional and attentive. It has made me a happy customer at all levels

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: Rachel Gavalier
Reviews.Content: It works very well. The zoom is very good and also has great quality in the pictures. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic 30X optical zoom
Reviews.Author: B. Hayes
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this camera. It takes great indoor pictures and with the wide range of the lens, you can frame the picture as you want. The display is very good on the LCD and the viewfinder. The deer and turkeys, that normally frequent my yard, have been camera shy since I got it, so I haven't got to try the full effects of the 30X optical zoom. My older cameras include a Sony F707, with a 10X lens, and a Canon F1, with a 1000MM lens, and this Fuji is far superior to either. It is also capable of great macro shots on wild flowers or anything else close-up. It does not include any memory, so remember to purchase that, if you get the camera. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture taking experience for an amateur user on this FUJIFILM SL300
Reviews.Author: Stephen Fu
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this product not get loved by amateur users.  And i don't know how this camera don't get 4.5 stars.I shoot photos with the automatic function for a while and i must say it shoots brilliant photos in daylight. I find the colours very natural in outdoors. Just only on automatic I am very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the photos taken. It must have something to do with fuji quality lens. Automatic.. automatic.. just automatic function is enough to impress me. If your using in the dark, it still can be okay if you pop up the flash. Incredibly enough, the pictures still can come out quite detailed. At least, it is satisfyingly detailed for me. But if you think automatic function is about it for this camera, you are terribly wrong.There are many interesting features like the EVF, zoom and the many presets function on the function dial. Personally if you asked me, i like cameras to have a viewfinder. It is not about the viewfinder how functional it is or how "extra and unnecessary it can be", but that it gives you options to use whichever you want to. For an amateur photographer/user, that can be a liberating experience- the old film camera way or the new digital way. When an affordable camera gives a newbie options, it can be almost an adventurous experience when you can choose to switch back and forth to use LCD or the EVF, exploring different styles of capturing images. It is rare to find a digital camera with EVF all-in-one purchase, moreover at this affordable price.There are many presets functions that are useful. One particular one which i found fun was the multi-shot. The 3 photos are taken in a zoom- in manner. So the first one was like 1x zoom and the second one zoom in further on the subject and the third one even more focus on the subject(like 3x). It works something like that, pardon my vague description. The main thing is that the 3 photos for that multi-shoot all look incredible in their own ways- different, each of them portrays the subject differently.I also tried the panoramic ones but not as pleasing. The images are slightly fragmented, you can see some weird fragments. But it can be easy to use though.The F-stops under manual is too restricting. There's only 2 f-stops30x optical zoom provide lots of zoom enough but anything higher than 14x zoom it will take forever to focus. The focus time is slow but at times still works okay. Sometimes doesnt focus at all(auto) which is a little disappointing.This camera is definitely not pocketable and i wont pocket any camera if i can. It's so easy to damage the lens if you are not careful. The provided accessories like neck-sling and lens cap are good enough so you dont have to go look for another one.No comments on video-taking. Functional enough for me.Battery life sucks though. Got into 2 bar battery after 30-40 shots. Not satisfying enough. Get another spare battery with you.Still despite all this cons, i find this camera to my liking. Stylish looking camera with great features and performance.PROS:-Outstanding Image quality. Truly amazing pictures and colours(saturation, balance)-Great  and many features-Stylish medium size compact cameraCONS:-Lousy battery-Lousy focus on zoom mode

Reviews.Title: This camera is great for hockey!
Reviews.Author: Jinnie
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely delighted with this camera, as is my daugter-in-law for whom I bought it!  It was a teriffic bargain and is JUST what she needed to film her son (my wonderful little grandson) as he defends his goal in hockey!  The 30x optical zoom allows her to get all his great saves from her spot in the bleachers.  I couldn't wait until Christmas to give it to her, when the season would be half over!  Thank you for this wonderful camera and this great price!  The photos are clear and quick and the videos are great!

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: This camera is so worth it!!  It doesn't do itself justice on here.  They need more discription cause IT IS AMAZING!!!!  AND the price is so cheap it might scare you  BUT I love it!!  So glad I bought it!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect choice except, OOPS, it broke.
Reviews.Author: Tergenna
Reviews.Content: I am the kind of person that will research for 2-3 weeks before I buy something of a technical nature. I had very specific  requirements I was looking for in a new camera. I compared at least 7 cameras before I made my decision. I made my mind up and ordered this camera. I was very happy. Then it broke two days later. The cheap lever to turn on and off the camera broke, obviously making it useless. I sent it back, got refund quickly(appreciated) and then bought my #2 choice. I have no problems now. I do understand sometimes one little thing can go wrong wit almost anything manufactured But I still didn't want to chance having to go through that again. The camera itself was 99% of what I was looking for, so depending on your needs this may be a perfect match for you. Now I own a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with high(long) zoom.
Reviews.Author: S.  R. "S.  R."
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this Fujifilm Fine Pix SL300, I have read so many customers' reviews.  Most of them are positive and only few are unsatsifactory.  Then, after testing this camera for a few days, I really love this camera because it has all the functions it claims and easy to use it.  Panorama is amazingly easy to use.  The quality of the pictures I took is extremely clear and bright.(above my expectation).  As for other functions, I have to read the user's manual to test them out and they are easy to use in the end.  Even though this is a entry level for SLR camera, it's already good enough for me since I am NOT using it professionally.  Most SLR costs a lot but this one is an inexpensive model for you to see if you need to go to the sophiscated model.  Like my wife said:  "This model is complicated enough,  don't give me more functions.  I only need to take some clear pictures and video.  I will be very satisfied if the quality of photos and video is bright & clear."  Overall, I'd recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lynne C. Berghoff "Nana of seven"
Reviews.Content: Although I've only been using this camera for two weeks, I'm pleased with it. I love the long zoom. I can't wait for spring to take lots of outdoor pictures. Inside shots have been fine. It's a simple camera, so easy to use. With a grandchild on the way, I know I'll be using the baby mode constantly. I really enjoy the mode where you take one picture, but it takes it with and without flash, so you are able to choose the one you like best. Just getting to know the camera, but I've noticed the color seems very true in my pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Fuji FinePix cameras through the years and this one stacks up with my favorites.  The slight "lag" with the shutter suits me perfectly as I usually deal with still life or inanimate subjects. So the lack of vibration is necessary for my shots.  This is recommended if you don't need "action" (I have not photographed action shots so cannot judge).  It handles and is balanced well. I also use Nikon DSLR and Toyo 4x5.  I like the idea of a non-black or silver body.  Thanks, Fuji!

Reviews.Title: Perfect !
Reviews.Author: trsneezy
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my daughter for Xmas. She is a photographer and I was nervous about getting a camera that was under $200 because she wanted one that cost over $400 but I couldn't afford it so I bought this one and she LOVES it !! It takes awesome pictures and according to her it is easy to use. I'm really happy with this purchase, good quality, low price. Arrived in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Fun Fujiilm Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard P. Thorne "Ric T"
Reviews.Content: Years ago I sold 35mm SLR cameras, even spent $1000 for a Nikon F2....this was when I was in my 20's and 30's...I am 65 now and do not have the patience for F/stops, shutter speeds,etc. This SL-300 digital really filled my needs. Excellent design, tho took a bit to figure all the settings out. The video feature is nice too, for short 10 minute clips,etc....a bit grainy but this unit is NOT meant to sub for HD camcorder, but had fun with clips on New Years eve. The pictures are very clear(14 MP enuff for me). The price point from Amazon is a steal. Then got the suggested Case logic carrying case, a 16gb transend memory card. VERY HAPPY with this purchase at a great price and fast shipping. The LCD 3" screen is nice, too. Also like the ability to use LCD OR the Viewfinder to frame shots. The View finder helps in bright sunlight. GREAT PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: Great versatility for the price
Reviews.Author: neflmom
Reviews.Content: I am just getting into digital photography and am a total novice.  This camera has performed very well in the month that I've owned it.  I am still discovering all that it can do and just started to experiment with the manual mode.  I've had good luck with portraits, wildlife photos & night pics.  I think for the price, this camera is a bargain compared to much higher priced DSLR's.  It is not a professional grade camera, but for novices like me, it is a great option.

Reviews.Title: works like a charm
Reviews.Author: CLK
Reviews.Content: Got it, use it, love it! And i had a Canon G10 before it, so thats something.... right.  Ditto Ditto

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Marie Wagner "PeaPod"
Reviews.Content: I was very lucky to be able to buy this on a lightening deal on Thanksgiving day. My camera arrived Monday afternoon in perfect condition.  I wanted a camera with a really good, sharp optical zoom and a great macro too. I took photos yesterday and today both zoomed and in the macro mode. Learning the camera takes a little getting used to so be sure to read the manual.  The LCD shows an up close view of the item you were taking the photo of after you take the photo, if what you wanted in focus isn't just right, click to move the part you wanted in focus onto the center of the LCD screen and take another photo. Somehow, the cameras is able to sense from this action the area to focus on.  Haven't needed the flash, video or panorama yet so I cannot comment on these.  I added a 32GB flash card (be sure it is class 10) and bought two more batteries on Amazon. The camera includes a nice neck strap as well as a lens cover. The camera reminds me very much of my 35mm Pentax from 30 years ago. Seems between a true digital SLR and a point and shot digital.  I recommend this only to people who really love photography that cannot afford a higher end DSLR. Not a camera for those who only know how to point and shoot.  I can tell this is going to be my favorite of all my digital cameras! Can't wait to go to the zoo or nature area.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: etesfa
Reviews.Content: I been looking for a good camera without spending a lot of money.  after a few weeks research I found this camera for $150 where similar products were selling $280-$300.  Very good zoom in and excellent quality.  I only had this camera for two weeks now and I can't wait to take it to my trip.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality for the price!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: Bought as gift for hubby. Lots of fancy settings that take some getting used to. The zoom is awesome! Much better than our Nikon camera. The sports settings is different and he prefers to use other settings for wrestling and Tae-kwon-do competitions. Quick motion is captured brilliantly without blur! Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: chazbo
Reviews.Content: One of reason I got this camera is because it has a viewfinder and  LCD .Some times when shooting video it is hard to hold the camera steady while viewing the scene on the LCD plus it is hard viewing the LCD in bright daylight. The 30 zoom really gets you close to the subject. I also like the way the panorama mode lines up the different shots and takes the shot for you.

Reviews.Title: Fine Pix
Reviews.Author: S. Hannon
Reviews.Content: Amazon's gold box deal couldn't have come at a better time! I could not afford to replace my late, much lamented DSLR camera. So I've been trying to adapt to birding without a camera and just enjoying the sights as they happen rather than recording them for study and identification later. Definitely lessened the pleasure for me. So when the Fujifilm Finepix SL300 came available at a price I could squeeze out of my budget, I jumped at it!I ordered the red body - doesn't affect the camera in any way, but I love the cheery brightness of it. I've taken it out birding several times now, and have to say I am quite happy with it. I'm not a camera pro, so all the technical stuff is beyond me. It doesn't have quite the performance of my Canon EOS Rebel T1i, nor did I expect it to. But it easily outperforms my first digital camera, the Olympus SP510-UZ, and it was a darn sight less expensive than either of those.I've been able to take identifiable photos of small birds in trees up to 25 - 30 feet high above me, even in dim light, and the burst shooting has helped me record several really cool in-flight shots as well. The optical zoom stays clear and focused the whole way to 30x although the pictures get a bit grainy in low light. The controls are easy to use, basically consistent with both of my previous digital cameras, so the learning curve is not too steep. There are lots of options to tailor your photography to difference circumstances, and the SR-Auto mode selects the options that best match conditions in most cases. As with all auto-focus cameras, there is sometimes a discrepancy between what you think you're taking the picture of, and what the camera thinks (and focuses on). But less frequently than I expected. SR-Auto seems to know what it's doing.That's the good part. The most significant drawback I've noticed is that the battery doesn't hold the charge very long. I had to recharge after 82 shots. With the Canon I usually got over 1000 shots on a single charge, and the Olympus was usually good for at least 500 or so. If that continues, I will have to get a case of extra batteries, as I routinely shoot a thousand pictures or more per outing.Also, I miss the 400mm lens, and the digiscope conversion capability that I had with the Canon, so I will probably continue to save up for the dream DSLR setup, but in the meantime, I expect to spend several years of good birding, taking perfectly adequate shots with this camera. And if I ever get the dream setup, I know I will have a reliable backup to take along when I go out.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for intermediate photographer
Reviews.Author: Lori A
Reviews.Content: My daughter has a passion for photography, amongst other things.  She had already used her digital starter cameras, so I purchased this one for her birthday.  We have had it since March and it is still taking beautiful pictures.  The zoom is amazing, even if you take a far off picture and zoom in, it captures the details perfectly.  If you want a great camera, I suggest this one, it even worked in the terribly dim lighting at a school concert.

Reviews.Title: It's a great Camera for the price of sell
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vinicio Ramos Boone
Reviews.Content: The camera has the posibility to add a better flash, if you need to take some difficult scene in darkness, also has multiple functions to take many kind of photos. I think the best is the battery, because with the rechargeable battery I don't need to buy any alkaline expensive batteries and it lasts many hours.Other awsome feature is the zoom it has, with this zoom you can achieve very little scenes with high detail, also highlight pictures at a very long distance with high resolution and definition.You can see all the specific features of the camera at the following link:[...]

Reviews.Title: great camera for great price
Reviews.Author: A. Cobb
Reviews.Content: Read alot of mixed reviews but i decided to give a try..couldnt be any worst then our current camera. I didnt what to expect but the picture quality is amazing and its worth the buy. I may be purchasing another one in the near future for my freelance photography business. I didnt need  a over priced camera when i can do the same job if not better with this one or one similar in price range. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Great camera, I had read the reviews before I bought it and was a little worried about previous reviews. But we have really took some great photos and the zoom is good also. Very Satisfied

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Makes your shots look professional with very little effort. Great Choice.If you don't want to spend a lot of money and get great results, this is the camera for you. I've used Fuji products for years with great results and this has been more evidence of that experience.

Reviews.Title: FUJIFILM camera
Reviews.Author: Roberta Sargent
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. Still learning all the settings. I take pictures in a dark club, so some pictures are coming out blurry. Not sure if it's the camera setting or the camera. My small Kodak Easy Share took better club pics. But....with that all being said, this camera takes beautiful pictures at home and outside!!  Closeups are perfect.  I would recommend this camera to people who take every day photos...family, scenery, etc.  I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Lizzy "Lizzy"
Reviews.Content: I looked for a long time, reading reviews going over specs and finally decided on the fuji sl300. I really love all the things you can do with it. The setting for portraits, night, fireworks amount many others makes it a lot easier to take a great pic. The panoramic setting is my favorite can't wait to go to the ocean and use that. And for those who want the easy photo taking it has that to.  Read the book to learn all the great things to do with this great camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Madison Lopomo
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera it is my first "fancy camera" and I am inlove! It has really great quality and the zoom is incredible I stood at the corner and got 6 blocks up with the zoom! It's absolutely perfect! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: great but frustrating
Reviews.Author: housewife "mother of 4"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes beautiful pictures and the zoom works great. I still have trouble finding all the menu features so that I can do a variety of things with it.  I don't like the program enclosed for collecting pictures on the computer. I am used to another program which makes moving pictures to the social networks easier although the e-mail feature of this one works good.

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: Ivan chaves "ivan"
Reviews.Content: i really like it, it's a little bigger than i tought and sometimes i get confused using menus, guess should get more familiar to them. photos quality is great and the scenarios allos you to take really nice pictures

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Jose Castaneda
Reviews.Content: This camera is great to start on. It has many of the advanced features such as aperture control, ISO, and shutter speed that I would like to learn about, without having to buy an expensive DSLR.The automatic modes on the camera are mediocre, but when set to manual, it takes great pictures! Recommended for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: G. Tennis
Reviews.Content: I just got my camera and am please with it so far. I had done my research before I bought this camera and it filled my needs. I have just started to work it and getting to know it better. It is not a hard camera to understand. It will come in handy for my art work. Love the zoom!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Deal! Perfect Camera!
Reviews.Author: Apollo Li
Reviews.Content: Great Camera with perfect user's menu.Really happy to have this as thanks giving gift. Compare to N's and C's, Fuji's has the best value of my dollar!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Divyesh daruwala
Reviews.Content: At first, i wasn't very impressed with it. We bought it for a wedding. At wedding the pics looked dull and dark. But when we saw them in computer, we were amazed and delighted. Though none of the point and shoot camera can withstand the quality of a D-SLR, this one can be used for outdoor photography and recreational photography. My friend has a Nikon (don't know the model) which looks similar to this one. And man! this camera can match the quality of Nikon.this one looks like a d-slr. that way you can satisfy yourself as if you are carrying a d-slr.it's good for parties (not in dark light), picnic etc.bottom line is, this is a great buy. It's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera.
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Got this as a christmas gift for my girlfriend, and she opened it early. She loves it, and I have to say it was well worth the money I paid for it. The only complaint I have is the lense. I thought when I purchased it, I would be able to MANUALLY adjust the focus on the lense. I was wrong. The only thing that is adjustable on the lense itself is the zoom, wich to me is useless seeing as how there is also a zoom feature on the camera itself. It also takes about 2 seconds for the lense to react when zooming. It is a bit of an annoyance, that's all. All in all I am happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: My third Fuji ultra zoom. This is the best.
Reviews.Author: artie11235
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use. It has a great zoom and two different ways to use the zoom feature. One on the left side of the camera and one on the right.The panorama feature is the best I have seen.You take the first shot and then pan to the right and line up one circle and x with the other and the camera automatically takes the next shot. I`ts foolproof. Their are many other features too numerous to mention. I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: So far, fabulous!
Reviews.Author: craftymommie
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to extend the quality of your photos, without the expense of a DSLR, I would highly recommend this camera. My shots have turned out beautifully and are 100% improvement in quality from the average point and shoot digital camera. Please note that you will have to read the user guide and study up a bit on advanced camera settings to get the most out of this camera, otherwise, you might as well keep using the regular point and shoots.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...got it for a great price!!! Amazon amazing deal
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera that I have ever bought. I must say that I am very pleased with it. I really got this camera because my tech guy told me that its a great camera...not too mention Amazon sent me a deal on it... I was like what! I have got to get it. The matte red finish is gorgeous, the grip is excellent, the smile detection is AMAZING... I just love it. It is my first purchase and I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: ramesess
Reviews.Content: My wife is an advanced amateur photographer. As often as not when we are in the car, she sees something and says, "Oh darn, I don't have my camera with me!" After hearing this time & time again, I got her the Fujifilm SL300 specifically to keep in the car. Our Canon XSi is 12MP, and with the L series lenses she uses, the quality is very nice. I hoped this camera would be suitable for occasional shots that would go missed without a camera.I chose the Fuji camera for the 30X optical zoom and 14MP density. Most shots she sees are nature, birds and wildlife when out and about. I also figured that the viewfinder, in addition to the onscreen viewing, would allow her to use the camera as she does the SLR.She's had it a couple weeks now and is quite happy with the results. A few of the shots have been posted on our webpage, [...] and compare favorably with other shots. The zoom is very good and delivers crisp results. She's learning the ins & outs and has many features yet to try. The camera is easy to understand, and follows many of the standards found on the Canon SLR. The SD cards are the same as our Canon, so no problem there.CONS:The viewfinder is a bit cumbersome to use. Instead of showing the image through the lens, it is a projected view. There is a small wheel that allows you to focus the viewfinder, but it is easier to look at the screen than adjust the viewfinder.The camera will not turn on if the lens cover is still in place; a message is displayed on the screen. You have to shut the power back off, take off the lens cover and restart the camera. That deer or turkey beside the road will be gone before she can get that done if she is in a hurry and forgets.The battery life is rather short, but that can be from spending time exploring the features. The battery is a rechargeable pack specific to this camera. You can't pop in some extra AA batteries. We'll need to charge the battery in the house, or get a car charger for our purpose.So, overall it is a nice little camera that fits our need. Reasonable quality, lightweight, long range and at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm SL300 is an excellent camera.
Reviews.Author: ROE
Reviews.Content: No this camera is not for the professionals. But it is a Grand camera just the same. I am an amateur photographer.  I love this camera. It zooms out to 30x optical and a whopping 200x digital. Yes you will need a tripod for the long shots. But it has so many different settings on it , i have just began to discover some of them. Don't be intimidated by all this camera has to offer. Fujifilm really out did themselves when they designed this one folks.

Reviews.Title: Average Camera for tropical land
Reviews.Author: Nazeeb Kadir
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for thanksgiving.The features of the cam is pretty good for its price. We were happy with its Zoom. Though it takes a few sec to capture the image in autofocus, the ultimate result was superb.The reason to return this product was ,the camera wont work below 35F (temp). I dont know if it makes any sense, but this is what we observed. We were not able to make the camera switch on , when the temp falls below 35F, it switches back when the temperature is up .Due to this I actually missed some beautiful pics that could be well shot in snow with my family.I would recommend this camera, to only those who lives in a tropical climate :)and prefers a gadget for a low budget.

Reviews.Title: Great point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Heme Prof
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! I bought an earlier version of this for my daughter in 2010 before a trip to Spain, and I bought myself a Canon PowerShot A3100IS for the same trip. Her camera worked splendidly, mine was a total disaster and died two days into the trip. Anyway, I decided to replace my dud with one like hers, and I couldn't be happier with it. It has some nice upgrades from the earlier version; the zoom is more user friendly, and the lens cap is an ingenious little device that you pinch and it fits inside the lens casing (hard to explain how this works, but trust me, it's a great feature!) There are so many different settings that I haven't tried them all, but I can say that it took some spectacular pictures on a recent trip to Yosemite. However, if you're looking for a little camera you can just stick in your pocket or your purse, this is not the one.

Reviews.Title: Great beginners camera
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: This great quality camera gives exceptional picture quality (if used and tweaked right of course). Even though it's a bridge camera, you can still adjust things like the aperture and shutter speed. The only con I would say is if you have a high ISO of 1600 in a very low light environment, the picture quality is very grainy. Another annoying thing is that you can't turn on the camera without taking off the lens cap, but that is just a minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: Autofocus off resulting in blurry photos and no help from the company!!!
Reviews.Author: Orchidmom
Reviews.Content: I was really happy to purchase this camera after researching cameras in my price range way too long... or perhaps not long enough as it turned out. Seemed to have everything I needed. However the autofocus is off by enough so that all my photos are a very soft focus to put it nicely. I contacted the company and emailed them 2 representative photos using a tripod and a timer delay to eliminate camera movement. I wanted to know how to calibrate the focus to get better images.They replied that it was my macro settings that were causing the blur and not a problem with the camera. Well, I bought it to take closeups so that was very irritating. What good are macro settings if they produce blurry images??? The only way I have been able to get fairly clear images is to autofocus lock then move the camera about 1/2" backward and shoot. Really not a good solution.This camera cannot be calibrated and so is pretty useless for my purposes. Just a heads up as some of these are not calibrated correctly at the factory.

Reviews.Title: Good Not Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Fitz "fitzeesmrs"
Reviews.Content: I have owned three versions of this same camera. I bought this one a few months ago to replace the 7mp version and was surprised when it showed up and is physically larger than the old version.Used it on a several week international trip and here's what I noticed:PRO-The zoom is very good. I can take pictures that come out very good from very far away.Has many different settings, that allow you to adjust for different settings like sunset, fireworks, flowers, etc.  These settings work well and the pics come out very nice. Love the sunset setting.It's easy to operate and the direction book is very clear if you are not sure what to do.Long battery life.CON-I HATE that the lens cap MUST be removed to do ANYTHING or the camera doesn't turn on, even just review the pics you have already taken. Other reviewers have commented on this and I didn't think it would be a big deal, but it annoys me more than I thought it would.I don't like that it takes "special" batteries, not just the standard buy-them-anywhere double AA's as the old version did. I bought a spare one so I wouldn't get caught without one that was charged.SUMMARY:It's a good camera, if you don't mind the size & the annoying lens cap that must always be removed. It is easy to operate and takes nice pictures, even from very far away.

Reviews.Title: shutter button
Reviews.Author: diana27
Reviews.Content: so I waited 2 days for this camera to come. When I got off work came home it was sitting on my porch waiting for me. I got it inside opened it up got it all set to take my pic of my dog Diamond. So I lift my camera to take the pick I push on the shutter button ....and nothing the shutter button didn't work. So im sending it back and im getting a replacement sent to me. Hopefully the new one will work. Ill keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: I love love love this camera!
Reviews.Author: melanie
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera for the price!  You can view through the viewer in bright light, which is unusual for a camera in this price range.  It has awesome zoom, takes great pictures!  I love recharging the batteries as I take so many pictures it saves a fortune.  You can take a LOT of pictures before you need to recharge them.  It has an image stabilizer that stops the blurring on the zooming for the most part.  I like the large viewing screen, too.  This is a perfect camera for the avid amateur photographer!  I can't say enough good things about it!

Reviews.Title: Repeat buy.
Reviews.Author: AnneMarie
Reviews.Content: I liked mine so much that I purchased this now hard to find camera for my dad's retirement gift.  It has clear crips shots, and great Optical Zoom, easy to understand control panel, and a comfortable design.  I dinged it a star for being a little slow on the sports/action shots, even with prefocusing the lense and the fact that the card in in the same compartment with the batteries, and the battery compartment is placed in such a way as to be blocked by a speed mount on tripods.  (Taking out the card?  REmember to flip the camers fully upside down, or out all the batteries come!)

Reviews.Title: Terrific!
Reviews.Author: Allen M. Karmelin "amkcpa55"
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner and this camera offers even more that I could imagine. I am still learning all the options and with each new feature I am amazed that I got such a bargain!!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jon Taylor
Reviews.Content: I have owned several different brands of digital cameras and I always come back to Fujifilm. They are by far the most user-friendly yet they have most of the features that I would ever want. If you're thinking about a new camera you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Cameron T
Reviews.Content: I really, really like this camera. I use it primarily for taking pictures of automobiles for a car website. The pictures are not the sole content, they just accompany the articles I write, so my focus isn't on taking artistic shots. It does it's job well and has a look that doesn't leave you mistaken for an amateur. I particularly like the 30x zoom and wide angle lens. It's all that I personally need in a camera, though I could understand someone with a hobby in photography wanting more. This thing is basically a point and shoot with a very nice lens and serious telephoto zoom attached. The hotshoe is handy, because despite the flash being very soft, it doesn't have a very far range.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: tryn2btechie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mother for Christmas and have been helping her with all of the features etc...The picture quality is flawless, it really is amazing! She is extremely happy with this camera. I would definely recommend this camera to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: I freakin love this camera!
Reviews.Author: KG Rollins
Reviews.Content: This camera takes the best pictures ever.  It detects smiles, auto focuses, adjust for the correct scenic lighting that you have....and it even tells you when someone blinked in the shot!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Tereza
Reviews.Content: excellent, a little big to take to ride. Very easy to take high quality photos and videos. Many configuration options.

Reviews.Title: A Gift
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for granddaughter who wanted to upgrade from her pocket camera. The Fine Pix was a very good choice. She likes it very much and is remitting the best photos to family and friends. It is light weight but not insubstantial, is easy to operate with many choices for bracketing and focusing while still delivering a great photo in automatic mode. Also, easy to move photos to computer and beyond, no complex, mind-boggling instructions.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Kane
Reviews.Content: Other than being a might small for my big handa and fingers this camera is all that I need and want, and then some.  I did a lot of homework before I made the purchase and I'm completely satisfied.  I still have alot to learn about this mini-computer posing as a camera but that will come with time and use.  I would not hesitate to recomment this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Would buy it again in a minute:)
Reviews.Author: Kim Hanna
Reviews.Content: I got the new Fuji in and I must say for everyday fun pics I LOVE this camera. The pics that I have taken have been very clear and the colors are great!!! I would recommend it in a minute for everyday use:)

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for capturing memories and sharing photos
Reviews.Author: JaneB3
Reviews.Content: The 30x zoom allows one to photograph wildlife and actually get a decent shot without scaring the subject. The portrait feature gives you a great shot of the person which is not compromised by background.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Thomas John

Reviews.Title: Close to 5 stars, but hard to call it perfect...
Reviews.Author: terpfan1980 "Barry"
Reviews.Content: I'm back to update this review just a little and note that over time I found myself more and more happy with this camera, enough so that I opted to get one (with the red body) for my brother's widow.  She'd taken some pictures with mine (with the black body) when we were all on a vacation at the beach back earlier this fall and found herself very much enjoying the experience.  In her words, she'd never had a nice camera herself, so getting to use this one (mine) was a treat for her.  The photos she took were all quite nice and demonstrated that she had a decent eye for getting nice pictures.There is NO difference between the red and black bodies other than the paint finish.  The red looks very nice and does match the pictures you see here at Amazon.  By getting the red one for my brother's widow it remains easy for either of us to pull out our camera's at family gatherings without worrying over mixing the two cameras up.  On the other hand, having two cameras that are otherwise exactly the same makes it very easy for either of us to pick up the other camera and just start snapping photos.I remain awed by the relative value of these cameras.  With typical Amazon pricing these cameras deliver great value for the purchase price.  They do "feel" a little flimsy, but again, I'd soften my original review a bit by saying these are good quality cameras that are easy to operate and light enough to carry around while being out and about where you think you might want to capture some pictures.Still not quite perfect, but closer than I might have said earlier. :-)Original review follows:Yet again I'm left wishing that I could give a product a rating somewhere between "I really like it" and "I absolutely love it".  Sadly that isn't possible, so I'm left rounding down a little as I try not to hand out perfect ratings unless, well, I'm dealing with perfection.It is hard for me to put my finger on exactly why I couldn't rate this item perfect, perhaps it's the bulk and heftiness; perhaps it's the "feel" of this camera which somehow misses on feeling as sturdy and durable as the Sony DSC HX1 (Sony Cybershot DSC-HX1)) that started me down lovers lane with the whole range of high-zoom digital cameras.  Even compared to the Nikon Coolpix P100 (Nikon Coolpix P100) that I later bought as I wondered if it was any better (for my uses) than the Sony, well, I'm still not sure... it's just this Fujifilm FinePix SL300 feels obviously different than either of those two cameras.  Note, even in comparison to the Sony DSC HX30V (Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX30V) that I've grown to like more than I originally thought I would, this feels much more cheaply made even though I don't think it really is.I would have to go a little further here though and note that the price tag on this Fujifilm FinePix SL300 is considerably lower and highly competitive compared to either of those previously mentioned cameras and that perhaps explains a bit of the difference in the feel of this camera versus those.  I suppose it is also entirely possible that Fujifilm made this camera feel as it does because it was part of a very conscious design decision to remove some of the heft and weight that those other cameras have, knowing that on optics alone, they were already faced with a camera that could be hefty compared to what most people might typically carry around as their primary digital camera.  Carrying around a good high-zoom camera can leave a user feeling a bit worn down depending on the length of time they have to carry the camera, not to mention any accessories (additional batteries, a camera bag/case, etc.) so eliminating some of the weight would be a good thing to aim for.In a previous review of lower end point-and-shoot cameras I noted that given the continued improvements in the cameras that are built into today's smart phones the more traditional camera manufacturers needed to do more to set themselves apart and offer a highly competitive product and I would say that perhaps was a large consideration for Fujifilm with this camera.There's an awful lot to like here.  A list that I really think is a bit too long to even start on.  Other reviewers and/or Amazon themselves may list those things in the product specifications or in their reviews, but I'll try to more succinct here (though I have co-workers and friends that would be amazed if I ever truly pulled that off ;-) ).I do like the rubberized grip around the lens area.  It offers a very comfortable and firm grip to the user.  Go beyond that and I'd note that I like the zoom controls on the left side of the lens (when you are facing the camera at a target).  It is nice to have those controls available to either hand and may help to leave lefties feeling some sense of inclusion in a world dominated by those that are right-handed.The zoom capabilities are impressive.  30x optical is near the top end of the affordable range.Add on affordability for that same 30x capability.  The pricing of this item is incredibly competitive, especially when compared against the other cameras (or the current versions/products in those lines) that I listed.I like the viewfinder and the option to NOT be forced to looking at the LCD screen for aiming at photo subjects.Not necessarily an advanced high-zoom camera, but not bad at all for someone looking to get into that realm without breaking the bank.  Really, when compared to other cameras feature for feature, a pretty darned competitive camera at a very competitive price.  Certainly worth considering as a great beginners high-zoom camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera with MANY features
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera through a lightning deal for about $130 US.  It has a whole lot more features than I'm used to-- I'm not really a technology person.  I'm used to just a simple point & shoot kind of camera with not many features, so this camera is a tad overwhelming for me, but I just look at it as an opportunity for me to learn more.  It was also more than I was really okay with spending, but its well worth it.  I was wanting a better camera than the one I previously had, for more professional-type photos and this was an excellent choice.  The user manual that comes with the camera is quite helpful.  I keep it in my camera bag just in case I need to look up which setting would be best for whatever type of photo I am taking.  I love that you can switch back and forth from the LCD screen and the viewfinder.  I find that having the rechargeable battery is so much better than having to put batteries in it.  I do recommend buying at least one additional battery, though.  I'm just starting to use my camera, trying it out, familiarizing myself with the features....and the fully charged battery was used up quite quickly.  I sure hope it doesnt normally drain that fast, but either way, it sucks when your battery dies and then you dont have a backup battery and you cant take pictures till its charged.  But again, I think the rechargeable battery is cheaper than continuously going through regular batteries, like some other cameras use.  The lens cap is a bit annoying since you have to press the grip levers...I'd rather have one that snaps on.  The strap that comes with the camera is good.  Feels and looks well made.  I LOVE that you can add notes to your photos... I had never had a camera before that was capable of that, so I find this very awesome.  You can take a picture, then go to review it and there is an option to add an audio recording to it-- for me this is helpful because when I travel, I can add an audio note so that when I go to look at the pictures later, I will have those notes as a reminder of the exact place I was at.  I'm not sure how silhouettes are taken or if this camera is capable, but I'd like to find out.  It has a panoramic setting, which I'm learning is pretty neat.  The 30x zoom is great-- you can zoom in REALLY close on objects that are far away, and it still picks up on all the detail.  I had a little bit of difficulty finding a camera bag.  I wanted to buy one locally because I think it easier to return items that way if I get the wrong thing as opposed to when I purchase online.  Unfortunately, the stores I went to around here didnt have much of a variety.  I am very happy with the bag I got, but if you plan to carry camera accessories with you, you'll be looking at getting, what I consider to be, a large bag.  I do wish the user manual was more detailed.  For someone like me who isnt used to a camera with so many features, it'd be nice if the manual explained more.  There are terms in there that I'm not at all familiar with.  Also, I like that there are little indentations for where your thumb and index finger rest.  This camera is most suitable for a right handed person.

Limited manual control5. Pop up flashThe bad and ugly:1.  Cheap feeling camera body2.  poor low light performance3.  Noisy past iso 4004. Reviews.Title: Decent Camera. Great Zoom!
Reviews.Author: V. Hutson
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a decent camera for the price.  The two features I like the most are the 30x Optical zoom and the HD video.  The optical zoom really enables you to get up-close to far away objects.  The HD video is always a nice feature.  It doesn't go as high as full HD, but it is still acceptable.This camera does falls short of my other cameras (Canon T2i and Canon Powershot SX230 HS).  Obviously, the FinePix SL300 wouldn't be able to compete with the much more expensive T2i, but it also falls a bit short in image quality, controls, and ease of use when compared to the less expensive Powershot SX230 HS.I have mixed feelings about the overall size of the camera.  It looks like a mini d-SLR and it is very easy to hold.  The downside is that it is very large when compared with my Powershopt SX230 HS and therefore not nearly as convenient to carry.Bottom line: Some nice features and I really like the powerful zoom, but I'll be sticking with my Canon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Adequate budget superzoom compact camera
Reviews.Author: J. Gitzlaff
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera; and though it has some nice specs (30x zoom, for instance), I really can't recommend this unit with the panoply of other choices out there.  On the good side, this camera feels nice in the hand.  Easy to grip, not fatiguing to hold, and all controls easy to access in sensible locations on the body.  It has the right number of physical buttons and a menu system that is intuitive to operate.At the same time, there are many negatives.  The EVF doesn't turn on automatically, you need to manually switch it on and off when you want to use it.  The image quality of the EVF is decent when holding the camera steady and facing a stationary subject, but the image refreshes so slowly that if you pan the camera or try to shoot a moving subject (kids) the image smears and stutters so badly you cannot use it. Effectively that means you need to use the rear view screen almost all the time.The 30x zoom is nice on paper, but the image stabilization can't keep up with it.  There is too much jitter and jump to use anything more than around 5-10x unless you have the camera configured to use a very fast shutter, which is difficult in the heat of the moment because so many controls are automated. Manual controls exist, but they take time to engage and are not as we'll implemented as in many  cameras that cost slightly more.  Couple the image stabilization shortcomings with the EVF smearing I mentioned above and you have a real problem.Other minor nits: this camera is pretty large and light. Feels like a plastic case with a lot of unused dead air inside. Image quality is decent for basic purposes, but there is little fine detail at the pixel level and a lot of over-sharpening around edges.For comparison sake, see the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX30V 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black) (2012 Model), which admittedly costs significantly more, but in my personal experience is a vastly better product.  The Sony has a MUCH better and more useful zoom all the way out to that camera's 20x maximum, mainly because of better stabilization and easier controls to ensure a fast shutter.  The Sony weighs about the same but is half the size of the Fuji, mainly because of better engineering so there is less dead air inside the case. Similar contrasts could be illustrated, but my point is that this Fuji may be a decent all-around budget superzoom, but it has problems and trade offs, and it probably isn't the best choice if you can save enough money to afford buying the next level up.

(the optical zoom is up to 30.) even not using the zoom at all, the focus was crappy.i boxed it back up immediatly, and will be driving over to the store and returning it TODAY. guess i'll just have to save up for my Sony Cyber-shot dSC-hx200v, which is AMAZING. my cousin has it, so this time i'm not buying a camera blindly. i should have known better than to make up my mind right there in the store, rather than going home, thinking it over, reading a few proffesional reviews.whatever.Just saying, good luck if you end up purchasing this camera.
